reviewText:
(EDIT) 6.2/10 - I had to change my tune...

Almost everything about this game is great. Even though it's 10 years old the story and graphics are still good enough to really enjoy.

Honestly, the controls were the worst part. Navigation was a real task. I prefer straight point and click for this genre. You always have to rotate your view to the right 360 degrees as opposed to going left. It's pretty annoying.  (The controls are greatly improved in later games.)

I originally voted this game down but after playing the later versions and realizing this game is a different animal I had to change my tune. I really dig the deep deep story and lengthy conversations. The details are impressive in this game. Books are filled with information.It's really slow paced but I like that sometimes. This element really wins out over the clunky controls.

Grab this on sale for sure.

**(Edit) I've installed the followup game Lost Sword of Toledo" Controls are in the same format but so much more fluid. I look forward to a good one there. Check the review when posted.
